c74object.name: j.parameter
c74object.digest: Declare a parameter within a Jamoma model
c74object.description: j.parameter declares a parameter within a model or patch. j.parameter is somewhat similar to the pattr object, while enabling a number of additional features offered by Jamoma.
c74object.discussion:
The parameter is an access point for controlling the processing of the patch. The parameter value can be updated immediately, or by easing over time. Common types of parameters, such as frequency, can be controlled using several different units (e.g. Hz, midinote or midicent) interchangeably.
The value of the parameter can be stored and recalled using model presets. User interfaces can access the parameter remotely. Mappings enable one parameter dynamically control the value of another parameter. Cues can control all parameters in all models. When designing cues, the value can be queried for every single parameter in the patch.
Additionally the parameter enables inter-application communication. The parameter is provided with a unique global OSC address. Parameters can also be declared on the network in order for other applications such as i-score to inspect and control models.

objarg.name: node name
objarg.description: j.parameter requires an argument definig a node name in Jamoma namespace. This is obligatory, and each j.parameter, j.message and j.return within a Jamoma model must have a unique name

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang at leftmost inlet outputs its current value

method.name: int
method.description: An int at leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. Depending on the @type attribute, the value might get converted into a float value if the @type attribute is decimal or array or into a string if the @type attribute is string

method.name: float
method.description: A float at leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. Depending on the @type attribute, the value might get converted into a int value if the @type attribute is decimal or into a string if the @type attribute is string

method.name: list
method.description:
A list at the leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. If the @type is decimal, integer or string, only the first list member will be used to set the value, and the type of this list member might be converted to fit the specified @type of the parameter
If the @type is decimal, integer or array and ramping is enabled (as specified by @ramp/funcion and @ramp/drive), the two last list members can be used to request a ramp over time to the new value. If so, the second last list member should be the symbol ramp and the last list member specifies the desired ramp time in milliseconds
If the @type is decimal, integer or array and a dataspace is used (as specifed by @dataspace and @unit), the new value can be set using alternative units. In this case the unit of new value is provided immedeately following the numerical value, as either the last list member or as thre third last list member if a ramp is also being requested. If an alternative unit is requested as well as a ramp, the ramping will happen according to the dataspace unit being used temporarily

method.name: address
method.description: The message address followed by a symbol sets the name of the node. This replaces the name provided initially as an argument to the object and allows to create nodes dynamically

The + message increments the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to increase the value by (default 1)

The - message decrements the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to decrease the value by (default 1)

method.name: dec
method.description: The dec message decrements the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to decrease the value by (default 1)

method.name: dump
method.digest: Dump all attribute settings to rightmost outlet
method.description: The message dump outputs all attribute settings to rightmost outlet

method.name: inc
method.description: The inc message increments the current value by the amount defined using the @stepsize attribute. An optional integer argument to the message specifies how many steps to increase the value by (default 1)

method.name: init
method.description: The message init sent to the leftmost inlet reset the current value to the value defined by the @default attribute

method.name: anything
method.digest: If the symbol equals the name of a setable parameters for the current ramp function, the value for that parameter can be updated. Else the message is interpreted as a new value for j.parameter. Depending on the @type it might be converted to one or more decimals (@type decimal or array) or an integer (@type integer).

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: The @active attribute allows to enable (default) or disable a node

attribute.name: clipmode
attribute.digest: Set how values exceeding range will be clipped
attribute.description:
The @clipmode attribute defines how values exceeding range will be clipped. Available clipmodes are:
none (default)
low
high
both
wrap
fold

attribute.name: dataspace
attribute.description:
The @dataspace attribute defines a dataspace used by this node. This enables values to be updated using several alternative units interchangeably, such as degree and radian for the angle dataspace. Available dataspaces are:
none (default)
angle
color
distance
gain
orientation
position
speed
temperature
time

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: The @default attribute set the value output at the leftmost outlet on model initialization. The default value can be overridden by the default model preset

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The @description attribute allows to associate a comment describing what this node controls. The description is used when auto-documenting models.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The @priority attribute controls in what order several values of a state of a Jamoma model will get sent on model initialization or when recalling a preset or cue

attribute.name: ramp/drive
attribute.description:
The @ramp/drive attribute defines the scheduler driving the ramp. Available options are
none (default): no ramping permitted
max: using the Max scheduler
system: using the system clock Note that in Max, it is recommended to use max rather than system.

attribute.name: ramp/function
attribute.description: The @ramp/function define an easing function used for ramping. A wide range of easing functions as well as windowing functions are available. Please refer to the help file for further details

attribute.name: ramp/function/parameters
attribute.digest: Configurable parameters for the current ramp function
attribute.description: The @ramp/function/parameters is a read-only attribute listing all configurable parameters for the current ramp function. Certain ramp functions as specified by the @ramp/function attribute have additional configurable parameters that can be changed dynamically to modify the shape of the ramping curve. The message ramp/function/parameters cause j.parameter, j.message and j.return to output a list of all such parameters from the rightmost outlet, prepended by the symbol ramp/function/parameters. Refer to the help file for j.ramp for an overview of what functions have additional configurable parameters

attribute.name: ramp/status
attribute.description: The @ramp/status attribute is a read-only attribute that will be set to 1 when value is currently performing a ramp, and changed to 0 when done

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The @range attribute defines the expected range of values. Depending on the @clipmode attribute, this might be a recommended or definitive range.

attribute.name: repetitions/filter
attribute.description: The @repetitions/filter attribute defines whether repetited values will be filtered out or not (default)

attribute.name: stepsize
attribute.digest: Step size when incrementing or decrementing value
attribute.description: The @stepsize attribute defines a step value used when incrementing or decrementing the value using one of the messages +, -, inc or dec

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: The @tags attribute allows to associate a variable number of tags for this node. This helps documenting the parameter, and is also useful when restricting namespace searches using j.namespace.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The @type attribute define the type of the value. Permitted types are decimal, integer, array, string, generic and boolean

attribute.name: unit
attribute.digest: Dataspace unit used by the node
attribute.description: The @unit attribute defines the dataspace unit used by this node. Values will get output according to this unit
